alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Hempstead; Lafayette; Nevada (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 10:19AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hempstead, eastern Lafayette, Nevada and western Columbia Counties, western Webster, northwestern De Soto, Caddo, Bossier Parishes in northwestern Louisiana and east central Panola Counties through 1100 AM CDT... At 1019 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Okolona to 6 miles southeast of Emmet to 7 miles north of Buckner to near Stamps to near Canfield to near Bradley to 6 miles northwest of Plain Dealing to Gilliam to near Mooringsport to near Blanchard to Greenwood to 8 miles southeast of Deberry. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Magnolia, Springhill, Prescott, Stamps, Waldo, McNeil, Haughton, Greenwood, Blanchard, Benton, Stonewall, Cullen, Plain Dealing, Cotton Valley, Sarepta, Bradley, Taylor and Emmet. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for southwestern Arkansas...northwestern Louisiana...and northeastern Texas.
